info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 24 at 2:49AM CDT until June 24 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of Central and South Central Kansas, including the following counties, in Central Kansas, McPherson and Rice. In South Central Kansas, Reno.
* WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional showers and storms are expected this morning and are capable of rainfall rates of up to 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hutchinson, Lyons, South Hutchinson, Sterling, Inman, Buhler, Haven, Nickerson, Little River, Chase, Arlington, Partridge, Sylvia, Alden, Windom, Plevna, Abbyville, Raymond, Yoder and Willowbrook.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: McPherson, KS; Reno, KS; Rice, KS
